info.name: Old Google Meet Scheme
info.description: Anyone else think the new Google Meet color scheme looks like a kid's toy? With the Classic UI going away for good on June 10th, 2021, I whipped out my color picker and gathered what the old interface used. With that information, I've put together a style that removes the silly-looking border from the speaker, makes the control bar white once again, and changes the background to the classic black, so you can easily focus on your meeting. I hope you enjoy it! :)
info.additionalInfo:
(This skin is currently in its early stages of development.) Latest Version: 1.2 Alpha Released on: June 9th, 2021 This skin does a very good job at converting the color scheme, I just decided to really in-depth with all the possible bugs. Most of them are simply one color being a different shade or something, nothing too major :) Websites change all the time. If this skin looks all messed up now, let me know so I can fix it! Feedback/things I missed are appreciated, (tech_how_youtuber55@yahoo.com) but please don't mention the following known bugs unless you can provide information on how to fix them: --Text on Google Meet homepage 'New Meeting' button missing --Text on 'Something went wrong' 'Rejoin' button missing -----(These missing items are due to the fact that the text on those buttons reuses the same class name. So I had to pick and choose, and I decided that it made more sense to ensure the buttons and text inside of the actual meeting were visible. --Polls, breakout rooms, Q&A, and other G Suite only colors are still blue. Sadly, I do not have my own G Suite account, so I don't have access to the necessary tools to convert the CSS code for those elements :( --Small dark flash on the main speaker/presenter --Captions button in menu remains green, because Google reuses classes from the Activities button --Change layout menu is still blue --Graphs in 'Troubleshooting & help' section are still blue (I've looked forever and can't find the class associated with the graphs! If you have an idea, lemme know!)
